data.title: NHL Expansion Draft: Results, picks for first Vegas Golden Knights roster
data.text:
For the first time in 17 years, the NHL held an expansion draft.

Wednesday night's 2017 NHL Expansion Draft filled the roster of the Las Vegas Golden Knights, the league's first expansion team since the Columbus Blue Jackets and the Minnesota Wild joined in 2000.

MORE: Golden Knights roster coming together

Each of the 30 NHL teams were set to lose one player in the draft, which meant there was a lot of intrigue to see who Vegas would steal from your favorite team.

Here's everything you need to know about the NHL Expansion Draft results and the Vegas Golden Knights first roster.

NHL Expansion Draft results, picks

Here are the expansion draft results as of Wednesday night. Note, there will be several trades and free-agent signings for Vegas in the coming days and weeks, so this is by no means the final roster.

Forwards

William Karlsson, via Blue Jackets Cody Eakin, via Stars Tomas Nosek, via Red Wings Jonathan Marchessault, via Panthers Eric Haula, via Wild Oscar Lindberg, via Rangers David Perron, via Blues James Neal, via Predators Teemu Pulkkinen, via Coyotes William Carrier, via Sabres Connor Brickley, via Hurricanes Pierre-Edouard Bellemare, via Flyers Chris Thorburn, via Jets Brendan Leipsic, via Maple Leafs

Defensemen

Clayton Stoner, via Ducks Deryk Engelland, via Flames Trevor van Riemsdyk, via Blackhawks Alexei Emelin, via Canadiens Griffin Reinhart, via Oilers David Schlemko, via Sharks Colin Miller, via Bruins Luca Sbisa, via Canucks Jon Merrill, via Devils Brayden McNabb, via Kings Jason Garrison, via Lightning Marc Methot, via Senators Nate Schmidt, via Capitals

Goalies

Marc-Andre Fleury, via Penguins Jean-Francois Berube, via Islanders Calvin Pickard, via Avalanche

When was the NHL Expansion Draft?

All 30 other NHL teams must submit their list of protected players by 5 p.m. ET June 17. Las Vegas will then make its selections by 10 a.m. ET June 21. The league will then announce the results on June 21 during the NHL Awards ceremony.

MORE: Everything you need to know about the 2017 NHL Draft

The exact time of the announcement has not been released; however, the awards ceremony will begin at 8 p.m.

NHL Expansion Draft rules

NHL teams must protect seven forwards, three defensemen and one goalie; or eight skaters and one goalie.

Any player with a no-movement clause in his contract must be protected. However, the player can waive it.

All first- and second-year players and unsigned draft picks cannot be selected by Vegas. Here is the full list of players who are available to be drafted by the Golden Knights.

Where is the NHL Expansion Draft?

The results of 2017 NHL Expansion Draft will be announced during the NHL Awards ceremony in Las Vegas at The T-Mobile Arena.

How to watch the NHL Expansion Draft

The NHL Expansion Draft results will be revealed on NBC Sports Network in the U.S. and on Sportsnet in Canada.

When will Las Vegas pick in the 2017 NHL Draft?

The Las Vegas Golden Knights will pick sixth in the 2017 NHL Entry Draft. The New Jersey Devils will pick No. 1 after winning the NHL Draft Lottery.

MORE: NHL Draft Lottery 2017 results

When can Las Vegas start making trades or sign players?

On March 1, the Golden Knights were allowed to begin making trades and signing free agents for next season. While Vegas doesn't have much to work with, that really meant that general manager George McPhee could start looking to acquire draft picks in exchange for not pursuing or taking certain players in the expansion draft.

On June 22, the Expansion Draft Signing Moratorium and Trade/Waiver Freeze for the rest of the NHL will be lifted at 8 a.m. ET.

List of NHL Expansion Draft players

Here is a list of the players protected by each team, as well as players made available, via NHL.com:

MORE: Predicting the Golden Knights roster
